names: Femoroacetabular impingement syndrome treatment (Evidence: pg no: 1, L15)
description: Treatment of femoroacetabular impingement syndrome and labral repair (Evidence: pg no: 1, L15-L25)
scope: Hip arthroscopic procedures for FAIS (Evidence: pg no: 1, L15-L25)
exclusions: Use of capsular plication as the sole treatment of FAIS (Evidence: pg no: 1, L16)
Evidence of advanced osteoarthritis, defined as Tönnis grade ≥ 2 (Evidence: pg no: 1, L20-L21)
Evidence of severe (Outerbridge grade IV) chondral damage (Evidence: pg no: 1, L22)
Positive broken Shenton line (Evidence: pg no: 1, L23)
Inclination Tönnis angle greater than 13-15 degrees (Evidence: pg no: 1, L24)
Labral repair in the presence of untreated severe hip dysplasia (Evidence: pg no: 1, L25)

codes.description: Arthroscopy, hip, surgical; with labral repair [when repair of the labral tear is associated with FAIS] (Evidence: pg no: 2, L64)

notes: Capsular plication, capsular repair, labral reconstruction, iliotibial band windowing, trochanteric bursectomy, abductor muscle repair, and/or iliopsoas tenotomy are considered incidental to FAIS procedure (Evidence: pg no: 1, L17-L19)
